p: Many thanks for the ten me make the trip! Of course I wasn't "put out". I've been pushing on most satisfactorily with Jed, and any letter, and a number have waited to be answered. Enot knows how Gaki is!

You'll no doubt be interested in knowing a bit more about our affairs. Since September 1938, Sig and Max have succeeded in selling $4190 worth of engagements. I think this is remarkable, considering the tightened finances everywhere. Sig has handed the business in a methodical and efficient way that certainly arouses my admiration and old Max has pounded out piles of letters in addition to what Sig has pounded out.

The above is gross. operating expense is of necessity very considerable - car rent, gas, oil, office supplies, stationary, folders, stamps, travelling expense etc. This easily amounts to 1/3 of the gross - perhaps slightly more. We hace all the figures, but this is about right. This leaves $2800 net from lectures. In addition to this we have had $2560, making $5360
that we have had for our family expenses and needs.
During the same number of months previous to the here considered, my income was $10,000, of which $2,000 was saved.

We have not at any time thus far been out of money, but $310 was borrowed last winter and is included in the $2560. There has been nothing bad thus far, expect that we could not keep up Alice's just allowance during recent months.

So long as Jed moves on as though I were getting it largely by dictation, I'll not be too afraid of the future. I do not count big on the proceeds therefrom, but the publication of the complete Cycle will have a helpful influence at the very least calculation, & could do much more. We'll be seeing you
Love to you and to old Lady Alice!
Am just completing a dandy crystal ring & am polishing two rubies.
